wikipedia_page.main: Major General Sir John Campbell, 2nd Baronet, of New Brunswick, Canada, (14 April 1807 – 18 June 1855), was a British army officer and the son of General Sir Archibald Campbell, 1st Baronet of New Brunswick, Canada. He died in the Battle of the Great Redan.

response: * Sir John Campbell, 2nd Baronet (1807–1855), Major-General, killed in attack upon the Redan at Sevastopol
* General Sir John Campbell, 2nd Baronet of New Brunswick, Canada
Sir Archibald's son, Sir John Campbell, 2nd Baronet succeeded to the baronetcy upon his death.
* General Sir John Campbell, 2nd Baronet, Campbell Baronetcy of New Brunswick, Canada
*John James Snodgrass's only child Archibald Campbell Snodgrass joined the 38th Regiment and served as an aide-de-camp to his uncle Sir John Campbell, 2nd Baronet

Small was the grandfather of Sir Archibald Campbell, 1st Baronet of New Brunswick and Canadian fur trader John MacDonald of Garth.  He was the great-grandfather of Sir John Campbell, 2nd Baronet of New Brunswick.  Charles Falconer, Baron Falconer of Thoroton is also a descendant of James Small, as well as Sheila Legge, the "Surrealist Phantom" from the 1936 London International Surrealist Exhibition.

On 3 November 1823, Snodgrass married Sir Archibald Campbell's oldest daughter, Maria Macdonald Campbell.     Maria and her family were members of the Smalls of Dirnanean in Perthshire, Scotland.  The couple had one child, Archibald Campbell Snodgrass, who, following the family's military tradition,  joined the 38th Regiment and served as an aide-de-camp to his uncle Sir John Campbell, 2nd Baronet during the Battle of the Great Redan.
